Ummm...... Isn't it actually more related to actions/stats? If it was a skill gap/relative to how others play, then there would need to be a moderator for MMR factored into a score. I'm pretty bad at the game, and when I duo w/ a friend who is a much higher rank I notice the difference, and the champ pool for what I can play and not feed like a soup kitchen is much smaller than what I can play at my ranked MMR and do well.

If it's about skill relative to other players then only diamond (maybe plat) + players would get S ranks. It's legit a stat game though bc it's about how your stats compare rather than skill. Also, if I get carried I will have better stats and get a better score, but it doesn't mean I played better, it just means the game was a stomp. Some games you lose or do poorly and still have a high score bc you were carrying, but how your team is doing often has a significant impact on your score. So while I like the system actually, I think it definitely leans toward more of an evaluation of was it a good game or a bad game for you in like 90% of cases in my experience.

Its not simply KDA though. I've had negative KDA's and gotten S+ not because I was carried (because the person who carried was A-A+), but because I was doing other things (killing dragons, split pushing, destroying turrets, BDing inhibs.)

Yeah, but I wasn't saying it was a kda thing, it is a stat thing. I'm saying that getting a 2-1-6 score with 4 turrets destroyed an inhib and 2 dragons to your name is the same stats (and same mastery score I would bet) whether you do it in bronze or in diamond. However, the player who does it in diamond has to be more skilled to get those same stats bc people react to plays better at higher ranks and value objectives more. For instance it is more likely that you can sneak a dragon (or 3) solo in low elo than that you will be able to do that in higher elo. Especially since if you sneak it the first time against stronger players they will add 6 to the time when they see the flash on your teammates saying you got it, and will ward around that time so you can't sneak it a second time.

That's what I meant by "it's a stat thing" rather than a skill thing. It is based off stats, rather than intangible influence (for instance I doubt it counts if you roam to another lane and push their lane out so your team can take tower, you are the reason the tower goes down but someone else may have had the last hit on it), or based on skill (the above example shows how the same stats can require different skill levels).
